alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 21 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, Jemez Mountains and Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep monsoon moisture will arrive over the area, leading to increased shower and thunderstorm activity. Many of the stronger thunderstorms will be capable of producing heavy rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
